title: 'Work for each other's security': Modi writes to B'desh PM Rahman, extends India invite
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Bangladesh's new prime minister Tarique Rahman on his electoral victory and appointment, extending an invitation to visit India. Modi highlighted the deep-rooted friendship and shared aspirations between the two nations, emphasizing mutual prosperity and security. He expressed eagerness to strengthen bilateral relations across various sectors.

title: From helicopters to HAMMER missiles: Key pacts signed between India and France
content: India and France elevated their relationship to a "Special Global Strategic Partnership" during French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to Mumbai. The two nations signed over 20 agreements, expanding cooperation in defense, trade, critical minerals, and innovation, including joint missile production and helicopter assembly.

title: 'Congress wins with dissent, loses when it crushes it': Aiyar's latest warning
content: Veteran leader Mani Shankar Aiyar asserts Congress historically thrives on internal dissent, warning suppression leads to downfall. Citing Indira Gandhi's Emergency and historical figures like Subhas Chandra Bose, Aiyar argues disagreement, not conformity, is the party's strength. He challenges the current leadership to embrace diverse opinions, fearing doom if dissent is stifled.

title: Missile message to Beijing? US to increase its fire power in Philippines
content: The US and Philippines are bolstering their defense in the South China Sea by deploying advanced missile systems. This move, aimed at deterring China's assertive actions, follows joint condemnation of Beijing's "illegal, coercive, aggressive, and deceptive activities." The allies are also increasing joint military drills and modernizing the Philippine armed forces, with the US planning further deployments of sophisticated weaponry.

title: Pentagon may label Anthropic a 'supply chain risk': impact on firm and partners
content: The US Department of Defense is reportedly considering labeling Anthropic, the developer of AI model Claude, a "supply chain risk." This move could force military contractors to cease business with the company, stemming from disagreements over AI usage terms, particularly concerning restrictions on autonomous weapons and surveillance. The Pentagon seeks "all lawful purposes" use.

title: 'There is a method': Ex-India coach decodes Ishan Kishan's masterclass vs Pak
content: Ishan Kishan has made a remarkable comeback in the T20 World Cup, scoring consecutive half-centuries and playing a crucial role in India's Super 8s qualification. His match-winning 77 against Pakistan, characterized by fearless yet calculated strokeplay, has been highlighted as a testament to his form and clear role at the top of the order.

title: 'Won't harm farmers': Shivraj on India-US trade deal; takes 'part-time politician' jibe at Rahul
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assured that the India-US interim trade deal safeguards farmers' interests, emphasizing imports only for self-sufficiency gaps. He criticized Rahul Gandhi's allegations as baseless and highlighted past UPA government policy failures. Chouhan also launched Bharat-VISTAAR, an AI platform for farmer support, underscoring the NDA's commitment to agricultural welfare and technology.

title: Jesse Jackson walked, so Barack Obama could run
content: Jackson once explained the purpose behind his activism with characteristic clarity, saying, “We have to build a movement that lifts people up, that gives them dignity and the power to shape their own destiny.” This emphasis on dignity became central to his political philosophy. He did not view civil rights solely as a legal struggle but as a transformation of self-worth, and he understood that this transformation required constant public affirmation.

title: Google’s ex CEO Eric Schmidt warns America: We are running out of electricity
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns America faces an electricity shortage, needing 92 gigawatts more power for AI growth.  Massive data centers are straining the grid, with projections showing significant increases in consumption and costs.  Tech giants are pledging to cover electricity expenses amid these growing concerns.

title: Ramadan 2026 moon sighting: Timings in Saudi Arabia, India, Dubai, UAE
content: Ramadan 1447 AH preparations are underway globally, with moon-sighting crucial for its commencement. In Saudi Arabia and the Gulf, the crescent moon is expected on February 17th, potentially starting fasting on February 18th. India anticipates sightings on February 18th, with fasting possibly beginning February 19th.  Official announcements are pending.

title: 'Vaibhav Sooryavanshi ko absent mark kar diya hai': Principal on class 10 board exams
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi has opted to skip his Class 10 board examinations to prioritize his burgeoning cricket career. Fresh off a stellar performance at the U-19 World Cup 2026, where he was India's leading run-scorer, Vaibhav is now set to play for Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2026.

title: Bank of America CEO says this 1960s theory proves that AI cannot take all your jobs
content: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan offers a measured view on AI's impact on jobs, citing historical data where technology doubled employment. He emphasizes AI as an augmentation tool, enhancing human capabilities rather than replacing workers, a sentiment echoed by other banking leaders.

title: 'From arsh to farsh': Mani Shankar Aiyar's 'Rahulian' outburst and 'uncle' syndrome
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar's critique of "Rahulian" politics sparks debate on the Congress's ideological shift from Nehruvianism to civil society influence. Analyst Rasheed Kidwai suggests Aiyar, though isolated, highlights a party increasingly shaped by non-dogmatic, issue-driven approaches, moving away from traditional party structures and veteran leadership's influence.

title: Shoaib Akhtar takes U-turn after calling Mohsin Naqvi 'illiterate'
content: Shoaib Akhtar's sharp criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi took a U-turn, with the former pacer claiming his remarks were misconstrued.  Akhtar insisted his 'incompetent and illiterate' comments targeted broader administration issues, not Naqvi personally. He expressed frustration over the India boycott stance flip-flop, while also critiquing player selections and Pakistan's overall cricketing approach.

title: 'Great place to find talent': Reliance, Adani group scout for young enggs, data scientists at AI Summit
content: Senior representatives from Reliance Industries Ltd. and the Adani Group are actively scouting candidates at the event, where aspiring professionals are presenting their résumés and GitHub portfolios to highlight their technical projects and expertise.

title: Quote of the day by Morgan Freeman
content: Morgan Freeman's philosophy emphasizes self-control and emotional mastery as true strength.  He advocates for rational decision-making over emotional reactions, urging individuals to maintain their life's direction.  This wisdom, reflected in his calm persona and iconic roles, offers practical guidance for better decisions, stronger relationships, and enhanced confidence in daily life.

title: Brad Marchand’s return fuels Canada lineup debate
content: There has been a lot of talk in NHL news about Brad Marchand's expected return to Team Canada's lineup for the Olympic quarterfinal against Latvia. Analyst Craig Button said that Seth Jarvis might not play because of lineup needs and his experience as a veteran. As head coach Jon Cooper finalizes his plan, changes to the roster are still a big story leading up to the high-stakes elimination match.

title: 'Battle of Begums' chapter ends: Bangladesh turns page with new nawab, Tarique Rahman
content: Bangladesh witnesses a seismic political shift as the 'battle of begums' era concludes. Sheikh Hasina is in exile, Khaleda Zia has passed away, paving the way for BNP scion Tarique Rahman's ascent. His return from a 17-year exile and subsequent electoral victory mark a new chapter, ushering in a generational change and a fresh political order for the nation.

title: Pakistan's problem isn't about skill or temperament — it runs much deeper
content: Pakistan’s recurring struggles against India are not rooted in nerves or talent but in a persistent lack of role clarity. Frequent chopping and changing, confused player roles and an overreliance on all-rounders have left the side without balance or a Plan B. As pressure mounts on senior players, Pakistan’s deeper structural issues continue to surface on the biggest stage.

title: MBA student's murder: Boyfriend drank beside body, abused it, then tried to 'summon' her spirit
content: A 24-year-old MBA student was murdered by her boyfriend, who allegedly engaged in necrophilia after strangling her. The accused then performed occult rituals and expressed a desire to communicate with the victim's spirit. He also sent a message to her family before abandoning her body.

title: 'Warship can be sent to sea floor': Khamenei's blunt warning to Trump, US
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued direct threats against President Trump and the US, warning that even the strongest military can be struck down. He highlighted Iran's capability to sink US warships and asserted that America will fail to eliminate the Islamic Republic, despite ongoing tensions and US surveillance efforts.

title: Draft Income Tax Rules 2026: How ITR forms are evolving - top changes explained
content: New income tax rules for 2026-27 propose redesigned ITR forms with more pre-filled details, aiming for simplification. Eligibility criteria for simplified forms like ITR-1 and ITR-4 have been adjusted, allowing for two property ownership and expanding disqualifications to include new income streams. Taxpayers must carefully evaluate their eligibility annually to avoid defective returns.

title: Gold and silver price drop: Delhi prices fall up to 2% on weak demand; global cues weigh
content: Precious metals saw a significant dip in Delhi on Tuesday, with silver falling to Rs 2.45 lakh/kg and gold to Rs 1.57 lakh/10 grams. Subdued demand, Asian market holidays, and softer US inflation data fueled expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts, impacting global prices and futures trade.

title: Om Birla meets new Bangladesh PM Tarique Rahman, hands over PM Modi’s letter
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla represented India at the swearing-in of Bangladesh's new Prime Minister Tarique Rahman. He conveyed a personal congratulatory letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Rahman, son of former PM Khaleda Zia, took oath after a period of political uncertainty. This marks a new chapter for Bangladesh following the interim government's tenure.

title: RBI absorbs nearly half of FY26 government borrowing via OMOs to support liquidity
content: The Reserve Bank of India has bought 47% of the Centre's bond issuances in FY26 to inject Rs 6.39 lakh crore into the banking system. This move cushions liquidity amid heavy government borrowing, preventing excessive yield hikes and supporting credit growth.  The RBI's actions have helped maintain stable money market rates despite market volatility.

title: PM Modi calls France 'special partner', H125 chopper assembly line launched
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French president Emmanuel Macron virtually inaugurated assembly line for production of Airbus H125 helicopters at Vemagal in Karnataka. The H125 Light Utility Helicopter Final Assembly Line at Vemagal is expected to strengthen India's indigenous aerospace manufacturing capabilities and further deepen India-France defence and industrial cooperation. Before the media briefing in Mumbai, PM Modi held comprehensive talks with Macron.

title: Rajpal Yadav’s first appearance after Tihar release – Video
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been released from Tihar Jail on interim bail until March 18 in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. He expressed gratitude to supporters and the film fraternity, acknowledging allegations against him. The Delhi High Court granted bail after he furnished a ₹1 lakh bond and the complainant confirmed receipt of ₹1.5 crore.

title: Businessman who filed case against Rajpal Yadav breaks silence
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has been released on interim bail in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. Businessman Madhav Gopal Agrawal, who loaned the actor Rs 5 crore for his film, detailed the 14-year legal dispute. Agrawal recounted his efforts to recover the funds, including emotional appeals and multiple agreements, after the film's commercial failure.

title: 'I was sold 30 years ago': Paperless Sonagachhi sex worker tells EC amid SIR row
content: Sex workers in Kolkata's Sonagachhi faced hurdles proving their identity for voter registration, with many lacking historical documents due to past circumstances like being sold. A special Election Commission hearing highlighted their plight, as they struggled to recall or provide proof of family roots. Officials acknowledged the difficulty in obtaining past records for individuals whose lives began in obscurity.

title: Zimbabwe create history, storm into Super Eight; Australia eliminated from T20 World Cup
content: Persistent rain washed out the Zimbabwe vs Ireland match, confirming Zimbabwe's Super 8 qualification and eliminating Australia. The abandoned fixture led to a points split, finalising the Super 8 Group G1 lineup with India, South Africa, West Indies, and Zimbabwe.

title: 'Imran Khan deserves dignity': 14 ex-captains write to Pak govt - full list
content: Indian cricket legends Sunil Gavaskar and Kapil Dev, alongside 12 other former international captains, have voiced grave concerns over Imran Khan's health in jail. They've appealed to Pakistan's government for adequate medical care and dignified treatment for the jailed cricketer-turned-politician, citing reports of significant vision loss due to alleged neglect.

title: Who is Elana Meyers Taylor’s husband Nic Taylor? Inside their story
content: American bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor created history at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics on February 16. The 41-year-old won the women’s monobob and secured her first Olympic gold medal. It was the sixth Olympic medal of her career. The achievement tied her with speed skating legend Bonnie Blair for the most Winter Olympic medals by an American woman.

title: 'Tughlaqi Commission' working on BJP's behest: Mamata sharpens SIR attack on EC
content: Mamata also made an explosive claim amid the ongoing SIR in the poll-bound West Bengal, saying a woman functionary in the BJP IT cell "removed 58 lakh voters’ names in Bengal using AI". The TMC chief said in Bengal, "160 people lost their lives due to SIR anxiety, work-related pressure". Mamata said if the election commission "penalises" Bengal government officers, her government would "100 per cent protect them".

title: Tarique Rahman sworn in as Bangladesh Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman has been sworn in as Bangladesh's new Prime Minister, marking a significant shift after decades of female leadership. Son of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, Rahman returns from exile to lead the nation following the BNP's landslide victory in the recent general elections. His appointment signals a new era for Bangladesh's political landscape.

title: Amid no-handshake row, Rohit Sharma's hug with Wasim Akram goes viral in Colombo - watch
content: Rohit Sharma and Wasim Akram's warm hug before the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash stole the show, contrasting with the on-field no-handshake policy.  Despite pre-match camaraderie, India dominated the game, crushing Pakistan by 61 runs thanks to Ishan Kishan's 77 and stellar bowling performances, securing their Super Eight spot.

title: Stock market: Here are the top gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today - check list
content: Indian equity benchmarks concluded Tuesday higher for a second day, propelled by gains in banking, IT, and capital goods sectors. The BSE Sensex rose 173.81 points to 83,450.96, while the NSE Nifty climbed 42.65 points to 25,725.40.  IT stocks continued their recovery, supported by strategic AI collaborations, while defence stocks also saw an uptick.

title: Tanmaya Shekhar on self-marketing Nukkad Naatak - Exclusive
content: Debut independent filmmaker Tanmaya Shekhar is releasing his film 'Nukkad Naatak' this February, starring Molshri and Shivang Rajpal.  The movie explores the stark differences between two close-knit worlds, using the creative medium of street theatre to address education and LGBTQ+ issues.  Shekhar and his team are self-distributing and marketing the film, traveling extensively to connect with audiences directly.

title: Pakistan: At least 17 killed in two bomb attacks, gunfight
content: A suicide bombing and attack by gunmen on a security post in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of 11 soldiers and a child. Security forces thwarted the overnight breach attempt, later killing 12 TTP militants. The explosives-laden vehicle also damaged civilian homes, injuring seven others.

title: NGT clears Rs 90K-cr Great Nicobar project, why it's a game changer
content: The National Green Tribunal has approved the Rs 90,000-crore Great Nicobar infrastructure project, finding sufficient environmental safeguards. Dismissing petitions challenging the clearance, the tribunal noted that a high-powered committee addressed outstanding concerns. The project, crucial for national security and India's Indian Ocean presence, will proceed with strict adherence to environmental conditions.

title: Putin, Women, Favours: Inside Epstein's Russia Connections
content: Convicted US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sought to build ties with Russia's political elite and appeared desperate to secure a meeting with President Vladimir Putin, files released by the US Department of Justice show.

title: Vevek Agrawal Wedding: All About His Father, Haldiram Chief Kamal Agrawal
content: Vevek Agrawal, the son of Kamal Agrawal, Executive Director at Haldiram Foods International Ltd, and grandson of the Haldiram Group chairman, recently got married.

title: AI Already Reshaping India's Wars: Strategic Forces Commander To NDTV
content: Artificial intelligence is no longer a futuristic buzzword for India's armed forces but a present-day operational reality, Lieutenant General Dinesh Singh Rana, Commander-in-Chief of the Strategic Forces Command, told NDTV.

title: 7-Year-Old Andhra Girl's Body Found In Drum. CCTV Shows Killer Walking With Her
content: A search for a missing seven-year-old girl in Andhra Pradesh's Annamayya district ended in horror when police discovered her body hidden inside a drum.

title: Opinion: Opinion | What ChatGPT Is Now Doing With Your Darkest 'Secrets'
content: For over three years now, millions across the world have treated ChatGPT like a confidante. And one company - OpenAI - holds the keys to this vast digital locker.

title: Ashwini Vaishnaw Apologises After AI Summit Crowding Complaints
content: Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister of Electronics and Information Technology, apologised on Tuesday to visitors to a global artificial intelligence summit who had complained of overcrowding and other organisational problems on the first day.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026: Decoding India's AI Growth Strategy
content: After a high-energy kick-off yesterday, the India AI Impact Summit 2026 is currently moving into its second day of shaping the global conversation on artificial intelligence.

title: Under 1% Reach 100-Day Goal Under MNREGA In Madhya Pradesh In 6 Years
content: A major political storm has erupted in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly after data revealed that not even one percent of registered labourers received the full 100 days of guaranteed employment under MNREGA in the last six years.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 2 LIVE Updates: Applied AI And Social Equity Key Themes
content: India AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: The summit at Delhi's Bharat Mandapamwill enter its second day on Tuesday, a day afterPrime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the expo featuring 600 startups and 13 country pavillions.

title: PM Modi Announces Special Global Strategic Partnership Between India, France
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who met French President Emmanuel Macron today, announced a "Special Global Strategic Partnership" between India and France.

title: 30 Minutes, 3 Warnings: Khamenei Targets Trump As US-Iran Talks Begin
content: Ahead of the US-Iran talks, Trump said he believed Iran was interested in reaching an agreement. However, recent statements by Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei have taken a different tone.

title: Teen Who Killed Delhi Biker Told Cops He Was 19, Birth Certificate Reveals Lie
content: The birth certificate shows the teenager, who was driving the Scorpio that rammed Sahil Dhaneshra's bike, was born on August 2, 2009.

title: "Mercy vs Mankind": Top Court Flags Perils Of AI Use In Drafting Petitions
content: The Supreme Court today flagged an "alarming" trend of lawyers using Artificial Intelligence tools to draft petitions, leading to errors and inaccuracies.

title: Who Is Vevek Agrawal? Haldiram Scion Who Tied Knot In Lavish Nagpur Wedding
content: Vevek Agrawal, son of Haldiram Group'sKamal Agrawal, married executive Kenisha Paliwal in a high-profile ceremony in Nagpur.

title: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh PM After BNP's Landslide Win
content: Rahman, who was in self-imposed exile in London for 17 years, had returned to Bangladesh in December following the death of his mother, Khaleda Zia

title: "Accused In Their 60s, 70s, 80s": Supreme Court On CBI's Appeal Against Bail To Lalu Yadav
content: Pointing to the ages of the accused - who are in their 60s, 70s, 80s - the Supreme Court on Tuesday adjourned to April 22 the hearing on a plea filed by the CBI, challenging the bail granted by the Jharkhand High Court to Lalu Yadav in treasury scam.

title: Iran Fires Missiles At Strait Of Hormuz As Nuclear Talks With US Begin
content: The US and Iran are holding their second round of talks about Iran's nuclear program Tuesday in Geneva as the United States ramps up its military presence in the Middle East and Iran holds large-scale maritime exercises.

title: "Lot Of Amazing Ideas": Peter Steinberger, OpenClaw's Creator, Joins OpenAI
content: Austrian software developer Peter Steinberger, the creator of OpenClaw, an open-source AI agent framework, is set to join OpenAI.

title: Tarique Rahman's Oath-Taking Ceremony Live: Tarique Rahman Takes Oath As Bangladesh's New Prime Minister
content: Tarique Rahman's oath ceremony in Bangladesh: BNP has bagged 209 out of 297 seats, while right-wing Jamaat-e-Islami secured 68 seats in the 13th parliamentary elections.

title: Man, 70, Dies After Being Allegedly Assaulted By Son In Bengaluru
content: A 70-year-old man died in Bengaluru after being allegedly assaulted by his son over property and family disputes.

title: Ideal fits for the NFL's 50 best free agents: New teams for Alec Pierce, Malik Willis, Riq Woolen
content: Which team makes the most sense for Pierce? Where do Willis and the QBs fit best? And where could defensive standouts excel?

title: Sources: Seahawks unlikely to use tags on Walker
content: The Seahawks are unlikely to use either a franchise or transition tag on running back and Super Bowl MVP Kenneth Walker III, league sources told ESPN.

title: Heise 3 lifts ISU hours after sister scores for U.S.
content: Hours after sister Taylor Heise scored to help the U.S. women's Olympic hockey team beat Sweden 5-0 in Milan, Nate Heise hit a go-ahead 3-pointer in No. 6 Iowa State's thrilling 70-67 victory over Big 12 leader and second-ranked Houston on Monday night.

title: L.A. mayor calls for '28 Olympics head to resign
content: The mayor of L.A. has called for Casey Wasserman to resign as head of the 2028 Olympics organizing team because of his ties to Jeffrey Epstein's former girlfriend.

title: UNC's Wilson adjusting to cast, to return 'soon'
content: North Carolina star Caleb Wilson is learning to play with a cast on his non-shooting hand and is inching toward returning "soon" after suffering a fractured left hand.

title: Rousey makes MMA return, set to fight Carano
content: Ronda Rousey will return to MMA for the first time in nearly a decade when she faces Gina Carano on May 16 in Los Angeles at the Intuit Dome.

title: Pegula leads push to improve WTA Tour calendar
content: American tennis player Jessica Pegula will lead a new 13-person panel tasked with making improvements to the WTA's calendar, rankings system and event requirements.

title: Shooting at R.I. rink leaves 3 dead, teams fleeing
content: A shooting inside a Rhode Island hockey rink Monday left three people dead, several others injured and the two high school teams playing fleeing the ice as it all unfolded.

title: The Bilas Index: Ranking the top 68 teams in men's college basketball
content: With a month until Selection Sunday, Bilas reveals which teams he has at the top of the pecking order.

title: Men's Bracketology: UConn retains its No. 1 seed -- for now
content: The Huskies remain on the top line with Houston's loss, but could they be better off as a 2-seed in the East?

title: Women's Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically NCAA tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: The improbable comeback of Alysa Liu
content: After retiring from figure skating at 16, Alysa Liu returned on her own terms, with her own quirky style. And she's an Olympic gold medal favorite.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: 'Blade Angels' take the ice, American teens in snowboard final and more
content: Tuesday at the Winter Olympics is headlined by Alysa Liu, Amber Glenn and Isabeau Levito in the women's figure skating short program.

title: Why the Lakers' quiet trade deadline could make for an explosive offseason
content: With LeBron James' uncertain future, draft assets and significant cap space this summer, the Lakers are set up to be a major offseason player -- and maybe even try to land Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: The ultimate debate: Skubal or Skenes? Buster Olney ranks the top 10 starting pitchers in MLB
content: We break down the best players at every spot on the diamond entering 2026, starting with a star-studded position featuring two of baseball's biggest stars.

title: From Arsenal to FK Qarabag: Why every team left will, won't win the Champions League
content: For each of the 24 remaining teams with a shot at the Champions League crown, let's talk about both why they could win the whole thing ... and why they probably won't.

title: Reddick's Daytona 500 win a buzzer-beater befitting of his boss: Michael Jordan
content: The race itself was a near-perfect representation of what the Daytona 500 has become in recent years.

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: Awa Fam, Olivia Miles, Lauren Betts and Flau'jae Johnson follow Fudd, the projected top pick in April's draft.

title: Ronaldo's next opponents have never lost a domestic match. Wait, what?
content: Which team has won every domestic match in its history? Which champions aren't based in the same country as their league? Here are football's unheralded powerhouses.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye shock move for Liverpool's Mac Allister
content: Manchester United are considering a shock move for Liverpool midfielder Alexis Mac Allister. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: College baseball Week 1: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: With upsets of top teams and electric plays across the whole sport, how did the top 25 rankings shake out?

title: Lapsed fan guide: Dodgers rule, offseason moves, trades, more
content: Everything you need to know about the 2026 season for the fan who has been away and is looking to dive back in.

title: Fantasy draft guide: Rankings, tips, strategy, stats and more
content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Who's really fastest in 2026? F1's new rules are confusing the pecking order -- and the drivers
content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

title: Why is the Champions League so easy for Premier League teams now?
content: the UEFA Champions League playoff round kicks off this week . the defending champs of both the Eredivisie and Serie A didn't make the playoffs . they were eliminated from the league phase, as were two clubs from LaLiga .

title: Buster Olney ranks MLB's top 10 relievers -- and there's no doubt about who's No. 1
content: coach Buster Olney ranked the best relievers in his 2026 season preview . he will roll out a position per day over the next two weeks . the team had checked in with the Athletics on Mason Miller's availability in the mid-2024 season .

title: Clark plans to resign as MLBPA boss, sources say
content: the move was made ahead of an expected start of collective bargaining in April for an agreement to replace the five-year labor contract that expires Dec. 1 . management appears on track to propose a salary cap, which could lead to a work stoppage that causes regular-season games to be canceled for the first time since 1985 . the union was scheduled to hold its first meeting with players this spring .

title: The biggest surprises of the men's Olympic hockey tournament
content: the 2026 men's hockey tournament has been thoroughly entertaining from start to finish . there is no other tournament where the best players are available to represent their countries with so much on the line . not every nation participated in last year's 4 Nations face-off .

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: Qualification round up next
content: the top four seeds -- Canada, United States, Slovakia and Finland -- have clinched byes through to the quarterfinals . the qualifying round matchups Tuesday are no. 5 Switzerland vs. no. 12 Italy (the winner faces Finland) no. 7 France (the winners faces Slovakia), no. 8 Czechia and no. 9 Denmark . Greg Wyshynski breaks down the men's hockey team's potential path .

title: 🏈 Which teams nailed the CFB transfer portal?
content: the 2025 season offered the ultimate proof that elite portal recruiting can put a program in national championship contention . the offseason transfer window has officially closed with more than 3,200 FBS scholarship players making moves in January . here's a look at the key portal pickups to know for each Way-too-Early Top 25 team .

title: Win projections for all 30 MLB teams -- and how the offseason changed expectations
content: spring has sprung early for baseball fans . we'll try to channel the anxieties of the discerning fan by looking at one outstanding offseason question each franchise seemingly left unanswered . how big of this need to go unaddressed?

title: State govt. delaying recruitment due to funds crunch, says Shashil Namoshi
content: He says Congress claims of achievement ring hollow in the face of 2.84 lakh vacant posts across 43 departments in the State

title: 30 km insulated cables laid in Konaseema coconut orchards to prevent outages: District Collector
content: 80 km of insulated network planned across coconut growing areas; 4,500 SC and ST families to receive free rooftop solar panels under Prime Minister Surya Ghar scheme by February-end, he says

title: Paper leak cases: High vigil for SSLC and II PUC exams
content: The II PUC annual exam-1 will be held from February 28, while SSLC exam-1 will be held from March 18

title: Museums are resistance against distortion of history, says Pinarayi Vijayan
content: The Chief Minister was speaking after inaugurating an AKG Memorial Museum at Peralassery in Kannur, featuring six galleries showcasing AKG’s struggles, his role in the freedom movement, parliamentary interventions, and mass agitations

title: Two Iranians held with over 200 kg suspected chemical substance off Gujarat
content: The bust was made after the Coast Guard intercepted a speedboat; police suspect new modus operandi to be in play

title: ₹150 crore sanctioned for replacing Dowleswaram Barrage gates, says A.P. Minister
content: The government is taking up 190 minor irrigation works in Kandukur constituency at an estimated cost of ₹10.86 crore, Ramanaidu informs Assembly

title: Kollam collectorate attached by court
content: Directive follows the State government’s failure to deposit compensation for land acquired over two decades ago, despite a direct mandate from  High Court

title: Evidence tampering case: court rejects plea by Antony Raju
content: The former Thiruvananthapuram MLA is likely to move the Kerala High Court next seeking relief in the case

title: YSRCP stages protest in Legislative Council as Chairman rejects its adjournment motion on TTD ghee row
content: Ministers rebut Leader of Opposition Botcha Satyanarayana’s allegation that Indapur Dairy that reportedly supplied ghee to the TTD had links with Heritage Foods

title: Congress grappling with internal frictions in Thiruvambady Assembly segment
content: The constituency is part of the Wayanad Lok Sabha seat represented by Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. While the DCC froze the appointment of the president of its Kodiyathur ‘mandalam’ committee, in Karassery, the constitution of the ‘mandalam’ committee was put on hold, while its president was retained in his post

title: Stalin virtually inaugurates four Thozhi hostels, new buildings for hospitals
content: The CM also virtually inaugurated 506 housing units constructed for the welfare of Sri Lankan Tamils living in six camps located in Chennai, Ranipet, Sivaganga, Tenkasi, Tirupattur, and Tiruvallur districts, at a cost of ₹33 crore

title: SSC hall tickets to be hosted on BSE website in first week of March
content: They will also be made available in the school logins, LEAP App, and WhatsAp Governance (Mana Mithra) for downloading, says official

title: Munnar records high UV Index amid sharp temperature fluctuations
content: Working hours have been rescheduled until May 20. Outdoor workers must observe a mandatory break from 12 p.m. to 3 p.m., while establishments need to adjust shifts accordingly. Prolonged exposure could disrupt local ecosystems and impact tourism.

title: Mahila Commission orders reverification of abortion data in ITDA villages in Eluru
content: Commission Chairperson directs field staff to revisit the houses and verify the data of all 281 abortions once again

title: Om Birla attends swearing-in of new Bangladesh PM; invites Tarique Rahman to India on PM Modi’s behalf
content: Om Birla said India stands ready to support Bangladesh’s endeavours to build a democratic, progressive and inclusive nation

title: Organise more eye camps for elderly in rural areas: Union Minister
content: Rammohan Naidu felicitates ophthalmic officer Sappati Vasantha Rao on his nomination to State Allied and Health Care Council

title: Congress, DMK together in fight against fascist forces, final decision on alliance by high command: K.C. Venugopal
content: Mr. Venugopal urges Congress leaders in Tamil Nadu not to make any comments on the issues surrounding the alliance

title: Legal hurdle cleared for NH-216 project in Narsapuram: Union Minister
content: Supreme Court dismisses landowner’s plea; 96% of land for 22.17 km stretch in West Godavari district already acquired, says Srinivasa Varma

title: Deve Gowda’s term in Rajya Sabha coming to an end in June sets off speculation over future of his six-decade politics
content: The Janata Dal (Secular) supremo and the lone member from his party in the Rajya Sabha, is set to end his term and the regional party does not have the numbers to secure his re-election

title: G.O. 117 brought during YSRCP term kept poor students away from govt. schools, says HRD Minister Nara Lokesh
content: The NDA dispensation has fulfilled its poll promise by revoking the order, and aims to spend ₹1,000 crore next year on school infrastructure

title: Committee moots State-level system to monitor preschools, creches
content: Assembly Committee on Welfare of Women, Transgenders, Children and the Differently Abled also recommends uniform and scientific curriculum for all preschools in the State

title: Mahasivaratri Brahmotsavams conclude with religious fervour at Indrakeeladri
content: ‘Poornahuti’ ritual performed at the old Yagashala amid Vedic chanting as part of the concluding day ceremonies

title: Bird bonanza in Vazhachal: 198 species spotted in survey
content: Rare endemics, hornbill nesting and rich habitats highlight the forest division’s global biodiversity significance

title: Gujarat's voter count stands at 4.40 crore in final electoral rolls published by Election Commission after SIR
content: The draft electoral rolls published by the ECI on December 19 pegged the total count of electors at 4.34 crore as against the 5.08 crore earlier

title: Death of minor girl under suspicious conditions triggers public outrage in Madanapalle
content: A day after the child went missing, her body was found in a water drum at house of neighbour; parents allege sexual assault and murder

title: Naidu, Pawan extend greetings to KCR on his birthday
content: They wish the BRS president and former Telangana Chief Minister good health, long life and continued service to people

title: KCCI submits pre-Budget suggestions to CM
content: Karnatak Chamber of Commerce and Industry urges the govt. to focus on North Karnataka’s holistic development with focus on the twin cities

title: College football had an incredible season. Remember how we got here
content: the Indiana Hoosiers raise the program's first football national championship trophy . college football has never been as fantastic as it is right now . the sport's blue bloods can still dominate, but new brands can compete for the ultimate prize .

title: 11 trades we want to see this offseason: Barnwell finds new homes for 15 players
content: it has been only a week since Super Bowl LX . it's already time for NFL teams to start thinking about offseason trades . 'the bill is a mock trade,' says one of the juiciest trade proposals .
